job_title: Data Analyst and Development Consultant - Per Diem at Penn Medicine
full_description:
\n
Description
Penn Medicine is dedicated to our tripartite mission of providing the highest level of care to patients, conducting innovative research, and educating future leaders in the field of medicine. Working for this leading academic medical center means collaboration with top clinical, technical and business professionals across all disciplines.
Today at Penn Medicine, someone will make a breakthrough. Someone will heal a heart, deliver hopeful news, and give comfort and reassurance. Our employees shape our future each day. Are you living your life's work?\n
Summary:
\n
\n
Responsibilities include researching, collecting, analyzing and interpreting the data to guide-decision making and improvement of operations. Assists with grant opportunities and works collaboratively with community engagement manager and team members. Provides administrative and logistical support as needed. Responsible for managing, summarize datasets, prepare graphics, report findings and conduct training on questionnaire design. Strong writing skills required.
\n
\n
Responsibilities:
\n
\n
\n
Understand research and evaluation goals in order to adapt appropriate research and evaluation methods, via Redcap and associated systems.
\n
Proficiency with Redcap system and developing instruments.
\n
Run reports and perform training for collaborating staff.
\n
Assist in grant writing and utilization of data to demonstrate program impact.
\n
Manages volunteer database, schedule and communications.
\n
Tracks food inventory, ordering, patron throughput, and bags distributed.
\n
Collaborate with patients and hospital staff to deliver a coordinated and seamless service through referral process andassigning "shoppers" to work with client.
\n
Works within safety guidelines for volunteers, clients visitors maintaining clean environment and food safety.
\n
Coordinates donation drop offs and checking delivery drop offs from community partners.
\n
Design basic training for staff to comply on Quality Improvement and Research methods.
\n
\n
\n
Education or Equivalent Experience:
\n
\n
High School Diploma (Required)
\n
Bachelor of Arts or Science (Preferred) with Education Specialization: public health/ healthcare administrationEquivalent Experience:â€¢And 1+ years Data analyzing experience.
\n
We believe that the best care for our patients starts with the best care for our employees. Our employee benefits programs help our employees get healthy and stay healthy. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits program that includes one of the finest prepaid tuition assistance programs in the region. Penn Medicine employees are actively engaged and committed to our mission. Together we will continue to make medical advances that help people live longer, healthier lives.
Live Your Life's Work\n
\n
We are an Equal Opportunity employer. Candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, marital status, familial status, genetic information, domestic or sexual violence victim status, citizenship status, military status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.
\n
